title: Director of Data and Analytics
htmlDescription:
About the job

Description


Fluidra’s seeking Director of Data and Analytics to join our team onsite at our East Coast office in Atlanta, GA (by airport).


What You Will Contribute


The Data and Analytics Director is accountable for the strategic governance and management of the North America Data and Analytics team.


Skills


This role requires a deep technical understanding as well as robust management skills to align data solutions with the organization’s strategic goals. You will be responsible for providing strategic insights to both executive stakeholders and development teams, ensuring that data architecture recommendations maximize the value of client data across the organization. Additionally, you will:


  • Drive the alignment of data architecture strategies with business objectives, ensuring that recommendations deliver tangible business value.
  • Initiate, implement, and monitor data initiatives and support data governance committees and data management working groups.
  • Drive implementation efficiency and effectiveness across the pilots and future projects to minimize cost, increase speed of implementation and maximize value delivery.
  • Ensure the organization complies with global data management policies plus data management and record keeping standards.
  • Lead discussions and presentations to business stakeholders, translating complex data concepts into clear, actionable business insights.
  • Engage effectively with non-technical executives, emphasizing the value and importance of modern enterprise-level data solutions.
  • Play a pivotal leadership role within the Data & Analytics practice area, focusing on the growth and development of capabilities and talent.
  • Spread innovative technology solutions by leading thought leadership on emerging trends, influencing the organization’s approach to data and analytics.
  • Actively deliver the roll-out and embedding of Data Foundation initiatives in support of the key business programs advising on the technology and using leading market standard tools.
  • Coordinate the change management process, incident management and problem management process.
  • Ensure traceability of requirements from Data through testing and scope changes, to training and transition.
  • The responsibilities will be split between playing a senior business and practice development role, and a people management/ delivery role (Strategy, advisory, architecture).
  • Ability to travel 30%, both domestically and internationally

What We Seek


  • 10+ Years of experience in enterprise-wide data warehousing, governance, policies, procedures, and implementation
  • Demonstrated leadership in driving innovative technology implementations and fostering an environment of continuous improvement.
  • Knowledge and direct experience with modern data warehouses and different components such as Snowflake.
  • Proven technology champion in working with relational, Data warehouse databases, as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
  • Strong management skills with the ability to oversee multiple projects and teams in a dynamic environment.
  • Excellent communication skills, with a proven history of effectively engaging with both technical teams and business executives.
  • Very Good understanding in Data Foundation initiatives, like Data Modeling, Data Quality Management, Data Governance, Data Maturity Assessments and Data Strategy in support of the key business stakeholders.
  • Aptitude for working with data, interpreting results, business intelligence and analytic best practices.
  • Good working knowledge and understanding of consumer and industrial products sector and IoT.
  • Functional understanding of solutions supporting business processes.
  • Understanding of Master data management, data visualization and story building, data science and machine learning is highly preferred.

EDUCATION


  • Bachelors in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics or Computer Science discipline or equivalent

title: Director, Analytics
htmlDescription:
The Opportunity


At Root, we’re on a mission to improve the lives of our customers by offering better insurance solutions. We challenge ourselves to think differently in order to reimagine insurance to make it smarter, more equitable, and a better experience for all.


We strive to “unbreak” the archaic insurance industry by using data and technology in innovative new ways. We believe we must be steadfast in our commitment to research, experimentation, and disciplined data-driven decision making in order to build products our customers love. Analytics sits at the center of our vision.


Our Growth team is responsible for ensuring that we meet potential customers at their time of need and provide an exceptional experience. This group includes Direct-to-Consumer Marketing, Customer Experience, and our Partnerships distribution channel.


As a Director of Analytics, you’ll lead a team of analytics managers and analysts to conduct exploratory research, design experiments to unlock new learnings, study the impacts of new features and business strategies, forecast future business performance, and introduce new metrics and reporting to shape how we measure our business. You’ll work closely with leaders in Product, Data Science, Engineering, and Business Development to achieve operational excellence and to craft longer term business strategies for your functional domains.


Root is a “work where it works best” company. Meaning we will support you working in whatever location that works best for you across the US.


Salary Range: $159,256 - $199,070 (Bonus and LTI eligible)


How You Will Make An Impact


  • Directly manage a team of three Analytics Managers and one Lead Analyst spanning Marketing, Partnerships, and Customer Onboarding
  • Facilitate near term project planning and lead longer term strategic planning (annual plans, quarterly OKR setting, weekly sprint planning)
  • Identify process inefficiencies and/or organizational bottlenecks and leverage these opportunities to improve outcomes
  • Work with direct reports and cross functional partners to identify, prioritize, and execute on research and experimentation opportunities
  • Lead our business forecasting process; work closely with direct reports and leaders in Finance, Product, Marketing, and State Management
  • Identify opportunities to improve analytical methodologies to increase business outcomes
  • Build strong relationships with other leaders at the Director, VP, and C-Suite level to coordinate across leadership and proactively ensure alignment and awareness
  • Coach and mentor individuals on the team to increase talent density and foster professional development and growth
  • Responsible for all activities related to hiring, onboarding, and terminations

What You Will Need To Succeed


  • 8+ years of work experience in analytics (prior marketing, customer experience, or insurance experience preferred)
  • 4+ years directly managing analytics teams
  • Proficiency with SQL and BI software (Tableau, Mode, Power BI, etc.)
  • Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, or another quantitative field
  • Superior problem-solving skills with ability to think strategically and innovatively
  • Exceptional written and oral communication; able to effectively collaborate with and present materials to VP and C-Suite levels
  • Detail oriented; able to effectively multitask across multiple domains; consistently maintains rigorous documentation
  • Exceptional leadership skills; able to effectively manage a team and influence cross functional partners
  • Roll-up-the sleeves work ethic and “do-what-it takes” attitude to efficiently execute and drive results in a fast-paced work environment

Don’t meet every single requirement?


Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Root, Inc., we are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway!


Join us


At Root, we judge people based on the merit of their work, not who they are. If you are passionate about what this role entails and solving real problems, we encourage you to apply. We want to learn about you and what you can add to our team.


Who We Are


We’re harnessing the power of technology to revolutionize insurance. Using machine learning and mobile telematic platforms, we’ve built one of the most innovative FinTech companies in the world. And we’re just getting started.


What Draws People To Root


Our success is in large part due to our unwavering standards in hiring. We recognize that our products are only as good as the people building and promoting them. We want individuals who find solutions by going through the cycle of ideation to implementation with curiosity, rigor, and an analytical lens. Ask anyone who works here and you’ll hear similar reasons for why they joined:


Autonomy—for assertive self-starters, the opportunities to contribute are limitless.


Impact—by challenging the way it’s always been done, we solve problems that have a big impact on our business.


Collaboration—we encourage rich discussion and civil debate at every turn.


People—we are inspired by the collection of crazy-smart people around us.

title: Sr Director, Data Analytics
htmlDescription:
About the job

SKIMS is a solutions-oriented brand creating the next-generation of underwear, loungewear, and shapewear.


We set new standards with our game-changing product and are a driving force within pop-culture.


We are looking for a Sr. Director, Data Analytics to be a founding leadership member of our Data, Insights, and Loyalty team. In this senior role, you will partner with stakeholders across the company to design and deliver analytics that drive the business and better serve our customers across a wide variety of retail domains, including customer, retail product, inventory, and logistics analytics. You will also support emerging strategic initiatives such as growth/expansion, new business initiatives/channels, and novel applications of data / analytics / AI in existing business processes. Key deliverables for this role include data products (such as dashboards, models), analytics roadmaps / change management efforts, and analytics team member management and development.


Primary Responsibilities


  • Own delivery of end-to-end analytic solutions (with support from the rest of the team) for a key functional area for the business, such as our product engine (e.g. planning/merchandising/production), customer focus (e.g. marketing, customer lifecycle/loyalty) or operations
  • Consult with leaders across the business to develop analytic roadmaps with particular emphasis on insights that accelerate growth across all aspects of the business
  • Lead a team of Data Analysts who support various functional areas of the business, including mentorship and skills development
  • Perform analyses that enable a wide range of stakeholders deepen their quantitative understanding of their business, with a particular emphasis on insights that accelerate growth and unlock scale
  • Develop dashboards, reporting, and other data products (such as simulation tools) that empower self-service, data-driven decision making
  • Work with our technology partners and data engineers to ensure high-quality, usable data are captured to support reliable business-facing analytics
  • Build scalable methodology and tools to accelerate development of our data and analytics practice
  • Lead initiatives to build data and analytics competencies across the entire organization with the support of the data, insights, and loyalty team

Qualifications


  • 8-10 years of experience in a data analytics or data science role, preferably working in a direct-to-consumer business
  • Demonstrated ability to independently plan and execute repeatable analyses and recommend actionable strategy
  • Ability to translate business strategies into multiple, interrelated projects and lead cross-organizational, cross-functional projects
  • Excellent communicator who easily bridges the gap between data and business owners
  • Creative thinker, adept at understanding an wide breath of retail analytics use cases and identifying the data and analytics necessary to make them into a reality
  • Builds and leverages networks across the organization to effectively lead change management initiatives
  • Excellent SQL skills with experience using statistical programming languages (Python, R, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large datasets
  • Experience creating executive-level dashboards using visualization tools like Looker (highly desired), Tableau, or PowerBI
  • Prior experience in people and team management of 2-5 years highly desirable
  • Demonstrated success working in a fast-paced, swiftly-changing startup environment
  • BA/BS in Math, Economics, Statistics, Analytics, Data Science, or other quantitative field highly desirable

$220,000.00 - $250,000.00 a year


Benefits And Culture


  • 100% Company Paid Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)
  • Kind Body Fertility Benefits
  • 401(k) savings plan with up to 4% match
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Full Access to LinkedIn learning
  • Employee Discounts

Perks (HQ Location)


  • Free weekly catered lunch at HQ – M/W/Th
  • Dog-Friendly office
  • Free Swag Giveaways
  • Annual Holiday Party
  • Annual Summer Party
  • Invitations to pop-ups and other company events
  • Complimentary daily office snacks and beverages

SKIMS is committed to continuously creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates, reflective of the rich diversity of the communities we serve. Equitable workplaces foster innovation and excellence, and in our commitment to culture of belonging qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

title: Data Engineering & Analytics Manager
htmlDescription:
About the job

Thrive is a leading behavior change technology company founded by Arianna Huffington in 2016 with the mission to end the stress and burnout epidemic. Thrive helps individuals and organizations improve well-being, performance and mental resilience with its AI-powered behavior change technology platform. Thrive’s Microsteps – small, science-backed steps to improve health and productivity – have been adopted by employees at more than 125 organizations in over 140 countries, from frontline and call center workers to executives at multinational companies.


As a Data Engineering and Analytics Manager, you will lead our data engineering and analytics engineering efforts. This role is pivotal in advancing our data maturity, building robust data infrastructure, and delivering actionable insights to support business and product decisions. As a key member of our team, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our data initiatives align with our strategic objectives.


While you’re a leader, you’re comfortable rolling up your sleeves and diving into the details hands-on when necessary. You’ll provide technical leadership and feedback to senior and lead individual contributors, and ensure that Thrive is using the right tools and processes for a robust infrastructure stack.


We need a kind and caring team player who takes responsibility for organizational outcomes and is ready to collaborate with Business, Product, and Technology partners.


If you’re not sure that you’re 100% qualified, but this sounds like a role you would Thrive in – we want you to apply! We believe skills are transferable and passion for our mission goes a long way.


How You'll Contribute


  • Lead a team of talented data & analytics engineers, providing guidance, mentorship, and support as a player-coach to ensure the team's success and alignment with product goals and Thrive’s vision and mission.
  • Design and develop features to improve the capabilities, robustness, accuracy and overall performance of our data analytics pipeline
  • Work collaboratively and foster strong relationships with Product, Engineering, Product Analytics, and Data Science to ensure product KPIs are reliable, accurate, and factored into the accuracy of the models produced and leveraged by the Thrive product.
  • Articulate the data engineering vision and strategy to internal teams and stakeholders through effective storytelling and presentations.

Must Haves


  • Demonstrated success in leading and managing high-impact data and analytics engineering projects. This includes overseeing project lifecycles, driving strategic initiatives, and mentoring technical teams to achieve project goals.
  • Demonstrated expertise in modern data stack components and infrastructure. Our technology stack includes BigQuery, Google Cloud Storage, Segment, Dagster, dbt, Kubernetes, and Airbyte. Familiarity with alternative tools is also valued.
  • Strong proficiency in SQL and Python is essential.
  • Extensive experience in data modeling, including star-schema and events-based modeling, preferably using dbt.
  • Proven ability to ensure data reliability, accuracy, and security. This includes implementing data governance best practices, creating and maintaining data quality standards, monitoring data pipelines, and ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and policies.
  • Ability to lead communications across multiple levels, from detailed technical designs and requirements with engineering to product initiatives with key business stakeholders.

What We Offer


  • Being part of a mission-driven company that’s truly making a difference in the lives of people around the world
  • Ability to develop within the company and shape our growth strategy
  • A human-centric culture with a range of wellness perks and benefits
  • A competitive compensation package
  • Medical, dental and vision coverage + 401k program with company match
  • Generous paid time-off programs

Compensation for this role depends on level, and will likely fall in the range of $183,000 - $250,000 We provide a competitive mix of salary, performance bonus, and equity


Thrive is deeply committed to creating a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment so that all employees can bring their whole selves to work.


Thrive is proud to ensure equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, genetics, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, family or parental status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.


Thrive is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. Please inform Thrive’s Recruiting team if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

title: Senior Director, Data & Analytics
htmlDescription:
About the job

Who We Are


WillowTree is a leading digital consultancy that partners with the world’s most admired brands to orchestrate winning experiences across the customer journey. Experiences that are personalized, on-brand, and consistent across channels and platforms. Experiences that can both drive customer delight and reduce operating costs.


Our services include digital strategy consulting, product development, brand and experience design, digital marketing, and data and AI services. WillowTree’s client roster spans industries and growth stages, including T-Mobile, Marriott, Allianz, Dexcom, PepsiCo, Brightline Trains, Synchrony Financial, Domino’s, and Dairy Queen. Check out how we have impacted our clients' digital portfolios over the years.


In January 2023, WillowTree was acquired by TELUS Digital (Symbol: TIXT), a leading provider of next-generation digital customer experience (CX) solutions for global and disruptive brands. The combined firm brings an unparalleled ability to deliver seamless, trusted, digitally-enabled experiences across any channel a customer might choose — including mobile apps, websites, voice UI, chatbots, email, customer service agents, and retail associates.


Location


This role will have the option to be in a Work From Near (Hybrid) capacity based out of one of our offices OR in a Work From Anywhere (Remote) capacity with travel to clients and WillowTree offices expected.


The Opportunity


As the Senior Director, Data & Analytics, you will lead the current Global Data and Analytics practice across multiple geographies, driving the strategy, growth, and delivery of data-driven solutions for clients, leveraging cutting-edge analytics, data engineering, and data science technologies. As the Practice Leader, you will lead a team of data and analytics professionals, ensure client satisfaction, and manage the practice’s revenue and profitability. You will have the opportunity to lead and shape a high-impact, rapidly growing Data and Analytics practice.


Responsibilities


  • Define global data and analytics vision, product, technical strategy, and framework. Develop and execute the overall strategy for the Data and Analytics services practice, aligning with company goals and market trends
  • Sell and deliver complex and innovative Data and Analytics projects for our clients, ensuring high quality and timely delivery
  • Lead and mentor a team of data scientists, analysts, engineers, and consultants. Foster a culture of innovation, continuous improvement, and professional growth within the practice
  • Lead and manage multidisciplinary teams, with a focus on driving collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement
  • Serve as a trusted advisor to senior client stakeholders, guiding them on leveraging data and analytics to drive business outcomes. Ensure high levels of client satisfaction through quality delivery and strong partnerships
  • Identify opportunities to grow the practice, working closely with sales teams to build relationships with new and existing clients. Lead efforts to create innovative solutions that meet clients' data and analytics needs
  • Lead the expansion of the global data analytics practice through the recruitment and coaching of global talent
  • Establish and refine processes to improve operational efficiency, service delivery, and overall practice performance. Implement best practices, frameworks, and accelerators in data and analytics management
  • Stay at the forefront of data and analytics advancements, incorporating emerging technologies such as AI, machine learning, and cloud solutions into practice offerings
  • Contribute to thought leadership initiatives, such as publishing articles and speaking at industry events

Competencies


  • 10+ years of experience in data and analytics services, with a proven track record in leading large-scale data-driven projects, managing cross functional teams, and delivering successful data transformation projects
  • Proven leadership experience in data engineering, data analytics, or a related role, with a strong background in designing and implementing data solutions
  • Prior experience leading client data technical engagements across data engineering, data science, and analytics workstreams
  • Strong leadership and proactive communication to coordinate with the project teams and other internal stakeholders
  • Experience with delivering data solutions on major cloud platforms, data technologies, and business management/visualization software
  • Experience leading and managing large multidisciplinary teams, with a focus on driving collaboration and continuous improvement. Proven ability to recruit, develop, and mentor geographically dispersed data and analytics teams - and win together
  • Strategic mindset with a proactive approach to identifying opportunities for leveraging data to drive business outcomes
  • Strong business acumen, with experience in managing P&L, revenue growth, and client engagements
  • Proven ability to be successful in an innovative, global organization, and to proactively enlist commitment from peers in delivering consulting solutions

Bonus Points


  • Masters degree in Computer Science, Data Science or similar, and/or professional certifications or accreditations in Analytics, AI, or related field
  • Experience that spans across consulting, agency, and client-side roles

Why WillowTree?


We offer a place to be yourself.


Our differences, both visible and invisible, benefit our teams, our communities, and the products we craft. That’s why WillowTree strives to build a team with diverse backgrounds, skills, and perspectives. You’ll work hard here; however, we’ll balance that with a culture that supports your growth and cares about your well-being. We’re committed to creating an environment of inclusion — a place where every Tree can thrive.


We want you to reach your fullest potential and part of your professional development at WillowTree will include dedicated time to innovate on passion projects and an annual stipend to fund your professional pursuits.


WillowTree upholds our core values in every aspect of our work. We promote safe and inclusive work environments and maintain a drug-free workplace. We celebrate our differences and provide equal employment opportunities to all team members and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Diverse teams build better products. We acknowledge that the tech industry especially lacks opportunity for those who are of non-traditional backgrounds and in underrepresented groups. In order to create the best products for everyone, we know that it's important for our team to reflect the diversity of our users, and we are committed to being the change we want to see.


What We'll Offer


In addition to a great culture and interesting work with opportunities for growth and development, this position is eligible for the following benefits:


  • Healthcare benefits - Medical, Vision, Dental (Including an option for 100% coverage of individual employee medical premiums)
  • Life & Disability Insurance
  • 401K matching
  • Flexible paid time off & paid company holidays
  • Parental Leave
  • Employee Share Purchase Plan
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • And more!
  • Individual compensation is based on various factors unique to each candidate, including skill set, experience, qualifications, and other job-related reasons determined during the interview process. Role ranges are periodically reviewed and updated based on market changes, internal needs, and industry trends. To drive ongoing pay equity for team members, WillowTree conducts regular compensation audits.

title: Director of Data
htmlDescription:
About the job

DaySmart supercharges experienced-based businesses with innovative, industry-specific software services that power customer and revenue growth. With thousands of partners worldwide and dozens of industry awards, we provide best-in-class solutions to accelerate their business.


DaySmart is seeking a visionary thinker to lead our data analytics team. title: Director, Business Intelligence
htmlDescription:
About the job

Infinite Reality (iR) is a global innovation company that powers the next generation of digital media and e-commerce through AI, spatial computing, XR, and other immersive technologies.


iR’s cutting-edge software, production, marketing services, and other capabilities empower brands and creators to craft inventive digital experiences that uplevel audience engagement, data ownership, monetization, and brand health metrics. Our portfolio includes a range of technology, sports, and entertainment assets that help customers achieve their goals. We offer customers features such as AI-assisted sales and customer service, the ability to leverage avatars, gamification and more.


Infinite Reality’s Enterprise division is a full service end-to-end solution for brands who want bespoke immersive experiences designed, built, and operated for them. iR Enterprise works with major worldwide brands and has powered programs for Warner Bros Discovery, Vodafone, LUSH, Hershey’s, and more.


Infinite Reality’s SaaS product, iR Studio, is a self service 3D immersive website builder that is designed to help creators and brands of all sizes enhance the customer purchase journey and drive deeper engagement with their communities and customers. No coding experience is required. Just design, publish, measure and monetize.


Hours: Full-time


The role


We are seeking a Director of Business Intelligence to lead the development and management of data-driven insights across our product and marketing teams. This role is responsible for building a business intelligence infrastructure that will help optimize product performance, support demand planning, and drive decision-making through the use of data dashboards, reports, and analytics.


The Director of BI will play a key role in ensuring data is accessible and actionable by partnering with cross-functional teams, including Product, Marketing, Engineering, and Strategy, to deliver insights that shape product development, budgets, and capacity planning.


What You’ll Do


  • Business Intelligence Strategy: Define and implement the BI strategy, working with product, marketing, and engineering teams to identify the most critical metrics and build a reporting infrastructure to track these KPIs.
  • Dashboard Development & Reporting: Build and maintain dashboards that provide real-time insights into product performance, marketing efforts, and customer behavior. Ensure dashboards are user-friendly and deliver actionable insights for various stakeholders.
  • Product Usage Analysis: Analyze product usage data to identify trends, customer behaviors, and areas of improvement. Collaborate with the Product team to surface insights that inform product roadmaps and feature development.
  • Marketing Performance Insights: Work closely with the marketing team to analyze campaign performance, customer acquisition, and return on marketing spend. Provide insights that feed into demand planning and help optimize the marketing budget.
  • Engineering Capacity & Jira Data Analysis: Collaborate with the Engineering team to analyze Jira data for sprint velocity, capacity planning, and resource allocation. Help drive operational efficiency by providing real-time insights into team performance.
  • Demand Planning Support: Provide the analytical foundation for the demand planning process, helping to forecast product demand based on historical data, market trends, and current product performance.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with the VP of Strategy and other senior leaders to ensure alignment on reporting needs and insights. Partner with various departments to ensure data integrity and consistency.
  • Tool Management & Automation: Select and manage the BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and data infrastructure required to meet business needs. Ensure reports and dashboards are automated, scalable, and regularly updated.
  • Performance Tracking & Optimization: Continuously monitor performance indicators, analyze trends, and recommend optimization opportunities across product, marketing, and engineering functions.

What You’ll Bring


  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • 7+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.
  • Strong technical skills in SQL and experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
  • Proven track record of developing BI strategies and delivering insights that influence business decisions across product, marketing, and engineering teams.
  • Experience with product and customer data analytics, particularly in understanding product usage trends and performance metrics.
  • Knowledge of marketing analytics and the ability to tie marketing efforts to demand plans, budget optimization, and customer acquisition strategies.
  • Experience in analyzing engineering and operational data, such as Jira data, to support capacity planning and sprint analysis.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data in a clear, concise, and actionable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong leadership skills with the ability to lead cross-functional teams, influence decision-making, and drive business results through data.

We’ll be extra pumped if you have


  • Experience working in an industry focused on immersive technologies, AI, or game engines.
  • Strong understanding of data warehousing and ETL processes.
  • Familiarity with demand planning and forecasting models.

Base Salary Range: $165,000 USD - $205,000 USD


Base pay will depend on a variety of job-related factors, which may include education, certifications, experience, market demands, and locations.


Benefits


  • Paid Time-Off: We offer flexible vacation time, 10 company holidays + we shut down Christmas to New Years
  • Health Plans: We offer robust medical, dental, and vision plans for you and your dependents. Disability, life insurance, and FSA benefits are also available
  • Wellness: Access to Teladoc and an EAP
  • Parental Leave: Paid leave
  • Retirement Savings: Contribute pretax earnings to our 401(k) Plan

Our Culture


  • Impact: Play a crucial role in our growth journey.
  • Culture: Join a vibrant team valuing creativity and collaboration.
  • Growth: Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Reward: Enjoy competitive compensation, equity opportunities, and comprehensive benefits.
  • Ready to shape our future? Apply now and be part of something extraordinary!

We’re looking for more forward-thinking and collaborative people to be a part of our innovation journey and mission to push the boundaries of technology. If you’re ready to help us achieve this vision — we’d love to hear from you! At Infinite Reality, we're looking for people invigorated by our values and drive to change the world, not just those who simply check off boxes.


Infinite Reality embraces a diversity of backgrounds and experiences and provides equal opportunity for all applicants and employees. We strive to build a company that reflects a global audience.

title: Director Data Engineering

About the job

We use technology to solve problems in spaces, light, and more things to come… for our customers, our communities, and our planet.

Acuity Brands, Inc. (NYSE: AYI) is a market-leading industrial technology company. We use technology to solve problems in spaces, light, and more things to come. Through our two business segments, Acuity Brands Lighting and Lighting Controls (ABL) and the Intelligent Spaces Group (ISG), we design, manufacture, and bring to market products and services that make a valuable difference in people’s lives.

We are positioned at the intersection of sustainability and technology. Our businesses develop technology that helps save our customers energy and reduce their carbon emissions. We achieve growth through the development of innovative new products and services, including lighting, lighting controls, building management solutions, and location-aware applications.


Job Summary

The Data Leader is responsible for overseeing and managing the data engineering and analytics organization within the company. This role will play a critical function in providing certified data products for the organization to enable data-driven decision-making and to ensure the effective utilization of data assets. The data leader will work closely with Enterprise Architecture group and Data Excellence group to develop the data strategy for the organization. The Data Leader will be responsible for leading data teams, executing the data strategy and fostering a data-driven culture.


Strategic Leadership

  • Oversee the development and maintenance of data governance policies and procedures.
  • Partner with Data Excellence organization to develop and implement a comprehensive data strategy aligned with the company's overall business objectives.
  • Foster a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting data literacy and awareness.


Team Management

  • Lead and manage a team of managers, data engineers and analysts.
  • Recruit, hire, and develop talented data professionals.
  • Provide mentorship and guidance to team members.


Data Engineering

  • Oversee the design, development, and maintenance of data infrastructure, including data warehouses, data lakes, and data pipelines.

Data Analytics

  • Drive the development and implementation of data analytics capabilities, including reporting, dashboards, and advanced analytics.
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify data-driven insights and opportunities.
  • Support the use of data analytics to inform decision-making and improve business outcomes.


Technology And Tools

  • Evaluate and select appropriate data technologies to support the organization's needs.
  • Ensure the effective use of data platforms and tools.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear and understandable terms for business stakeholders.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Passion for data and a drive to use data to drive business value.


Preferred Skills And Experience

  • Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., Azure ADLS, Synapse, Big data)
  • Knowledge of data governance and compliance frameworks (e.g., GDPR, CCPA)

About the job

Director, Consumer Insights & Data Analytics


Position Overview:


The Director of Consumer Insights & Data Analytics will play a key role in Brilliant Earth’s mission by helping the company better understand how consumers think and act through the Jewelry purchase. You will drive and communicate insights to optimize customer behaviors and the purchase journey, identify key segments across our customers, and drive marketing activities through data. You will play a key role in driving the data foundation, creating tools, defining best practices, and building Brilliant Earth’s data and analytics strategy.


As the Director, Consumer Insights & Data Analytics, you will lead a team to work cross-functionally and collaboratively to ensure that the insights of their work are incorporated across company plans from marketing to product development to the showroom experience.


What you’ll do:


Business and Consumer Insights:


  • Lead path to purchase research across categories, identifying new areas to increase overall site conversion, optimize performance and improve the customer journey.
  • Develop insights on shifting customer perception toward categories and the corresponding impacts on shopping behaviors.
  • Identify growth opportunities by analyzing user behavior, navigation patterns, page performance and conversion funnels
  • Understand and define the key factors in ecommerce and showroom experience for Brilliant Earth
  • Develop tools to understand and track brand strength for Brilliant Earth focused on changes in awareness, familiarity and consideration over time.

Consumer Segmentation and CRM:


  • Develop consumer cohort and purchase behavior analyses across purchase channels, to better understand and drive repurchase and lifetime value
  • Provide customer insights for brand, performance marketing and CRM teams for for use in optimizing marketing strategies and tactics.
  • Develop a reporting framework to continuously measure repurchase & lifetime value.
  • Play a key role in the development and data foundation required to support a Brilliant Earth loyalty program.

Marketing Data & Analytics:


  • Provide analytics and insights to stakeholders within the ecommerce and brand teams focused on both upper and lower funnel marketing activities.
  • Lead marketing campaign analysis across all channels including CRM, Social, Organic, and Performance and build processes which enable comparison of campaigns over time.
  • Develop full funnel attribution frameworks with consideration for transactions and activities which lead to transactions.

Business tools and monitoring:


  • Create self-service analytics reporting structures which enable data driven decision making to scale efficiently across the organization.
  • Develop reliable forecasting processes for key activities and business processes across the organization as a foundation for business health monitoring.
  • Develop monitoring tools and capabilities, ensuring business foundations and processes are functioning as expected and automatically alert business teams if outlier conditions exist.

Data foundations:


  • Lead and educate the organization on digital analytics; drive data and analytics best practices.
  • Ensure data source and tagging stability, focused on repeatable insights which can be trusted by business owners and teams.
  • Ensure projects and platform changes across the organization consider analytics, and new capabilities are building upon the data foundation.
  • Provide leadership in driving the organization’s data strategy and data foundations to ensure the organization is using data effectively and scaling sufficiently to support the business.

You’re a great candidate if you have:


  • 10+ years of relevant Consumer Insights and Digital Analytics leadership experience
  • Robust understanding of data and analytics technology. Experience leading strategy and implementation for platforms and tools such as GA4, Domo, Snowflake
  • Demonstrated experience providing insights relating to digital marketing channels and activities (Paid Search, SEO, Affiliates, Display, Paid Social)
  • Experience leading and driving consumer journey and website experience optimization analytics
  • Experience defining, developing and communicating CRM and Consumer cohort insights
  • Experience in consumer segmentation and developing a data-based cohort modeling
  • The ability to communicate complex concepts to a variety of audiences
  • Robust analytic, quantitative, statistical, and data interpretation skills, ability to transform data into actionable insights
  • Demonstrated success in leading and developing high-performing teams, with a track record of driving results through effective team management and mentorship.
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
  • Self-starter with a proactive and entrepreneurial spirit, able to thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment while maintaining a focus on achieving both business and social goals. Possesses strong problem-solving skills, approaching challenges with a positive and innovative mindset to drive solutions.
  • Familiarity with HTML, CSS, Google Analytics and Javascript are a plus
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, preferred

What We Offer:


At Brilliant Earth, we’re passionate about the employee experience. That’s why we offer an excellent training program and endless opportunities for career growth! In addition, we offer competitive compensation and a robust benefits package, including:


  • Insurance. Medical, dental, and vision insurance kick in on the first day of your 2nd month!

We are hard-working team players that welcome challenges and rise to any occasion. Vice President, Strategy and Business Operations


Description


Sprout Social is looking to hire a Vice President, Strategy and Business Operations to our Product team.


Why join Sprout’s Strategy and Business Operations team?


Sprout empowers businesses around the globe to tap into the power and opportunity of social media. Our software brings together social content and messaging, data and workflows in a unified system of record, intelligence and action. Operating across major social media channels like Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest, LinkedIn, Google and YouTube, we provide organizations with a centralized platform to effectively manage social media efforts across stakeholders and business functions. We’re relentless about ensuring the success of our customers and building elegant software, and are regularly recognized by customers for our industry-leading products.


Reporting to our Chief Product Officer, you’ll be a key member of Sprout’s R&D leadership team and the primary thought partner for our executive leaders in defining Sprout’s strategy across short and long time horizons. As the leader of our Strategy and Business Operations function, you will not only establish the strategy and business operations craft at Sprout, but also play a pivotal role in building and scaling the team to support Sprout’s future growth. Join other strategic and visionary leaders on our R&D leadership team as we guide and inspire our teams to deliver world-class products.


What you’ll do:


  • Drive the organization forward by implementing strategic initiatives and staying focused on aligning highest-level priorities with day-to-day operations
  • Address challenges like identifying high-ROI market segments, managing AI-related risks and opportunities, applying M&A to support growth, and making key resourcing decisions.
  • Determine what our competitive positioning or defensibility needs to be to sustain a long-term advantage.
  • Lead the annual strategy planning process, working closely with executive leadership to define long-term goals and develop actionable plans that drive organizational growth and operational efficiency.
  • Build out the Strategy & Business Operations function at Sprout, defining the job function and growth trajectory including setting hiring practices, job ladder definitions and performance evaluation practices.
  • Partner with the CPO and CTO to define Sprout’s strategy to accelerate growth, inclusive of product strategy and our approach to market segmentation.
  • Define the right OKRs and metrics to track and answer our most important questions and measure our performance against those objectives.
  • Create tracking mechanisms to ensure leadership has line of sight into work and progress, and accountability is driven across the team.

What You’ll Bring


We’re looking for a forward-thinking leader who will bring a strong vision and operational expertise to help us scale effectively, identify growth opportunities, and deliver exceptional value to our customers. If you're a strategic thinker with a passion for technology, a knack for problem-solving, and an ability to drive change and accountability in a fast-paced environment, we’d love to talk with you!


The minimum qualifications for this role include:


  • 12+ years of experience in business strategy and operations
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable insights
  • Proven ability to drive the strategy of a market-leading software solution
  • Experience working in a high-growth SaaS environment

Preferred qualifications for this role include:


  • Outstanding ability to act as a thought partner and strategic advisor to executive leaders
  • Strong communication and presentation abilities, both written and verbal
  • MBA preferred

How You’ll Grow


Within 1 month, you’ll plant your roots, including:


  • Completing Sprout Social’s new hire training & onboarding program alongside other new Sprout team members. You’ll gain a broader understanding of our products and how your role fits into the organization
  • Partnering with the CPO to define key success metrics for your role and how you will be measured against them
  • Diving into our products to learn about what makes our software unique and why customers love our products
  • Establishing relationships with other product, engineering, design and revenue leaders and identifying areas of opportunity

Within 3 months, you’ll start hitting your stride by:


  • Understanding the inputs/outputs of the business and developing a perspective on where we can improve
  • Assessing the impact of AI advancements on market dynamics and identifying opportunities for leveraging AI technologies to enhance product offerings, improve customer experience, and drive competitive differentiation
  • Taking ownership of major initiatives already in flight and partnering closely with analytics counterparts elsewhere at Sprout to accelerate improvements
  • Establishing KPIs and success metrics to measure GTM effectiveness and operational performance
  • Leading a competitive landscape analysis to refine positioning, targeting, and potential market expansion opportunities
  • Developing a roadmap for scaling resources and capabilities to support future growth

Within 6 months, you’ll be making a clear impact through:


  • Conducting and developing comprehensive monthly business reviews that provide actionable insights
  • Leading the annual planning process by setting strategic priorities and aligning departmental goals with company objectives to drive sustainable growth and operational efficiency
  • Establishing and building the Strategy & Operations function by defining its core objectives, structuring the team, implementing processes, and creating frameworks for continuous alignment, measurement, and improvement across the organization
  • Evaluating potential strategic partnerships by assessing alignment with business objectives, analyzing market impact, and forecasting ROI to ensure partnerships drive growth and enhance competitive positioning

Within 12 months, you’ll make this role your own by:


  • Continuing to enhance and refine Sprout’s Strategy & Business operations function to drive greater efficiency, alignment and effectiveness in achieving its organizational goals
  • Obtaining (solicited and unsolicited) and acting upon peer, customer and leadership feedback
  • Establishing and executing against a long-term plan for the business
  • Surprise us! Use your unique ideas and abilities to change our team in beneficial ways that we haven’t even considered yet

Of course what is outlined above is the ideal timeline, but things may shift based on business needs and other projects and tasks could be added at the discretion of your manager.


Our Benefits Program


We’re proud to regularly be recognized for our team, product and culture. Our benefits program includes:


  • Insurance and benefit options that are built for both individuals and families
  • Progressive policies to support work/life balance, like our flexible paid time off and parental leave program
  • High-quality and well-maintained equipment—your computer will never prevent you from doing your best
  • Wellness initiatives to ensure both health and mental well-being of our team
  • Ongoing education and development opportunities via our Grow@Sprout program and employee-led diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives.
  • Growing corporate social responsibility program that is driven by the involvement and passion of our team members
  • Beautiful, convenient, and state-of-the-art offices in Chicago’s Loop and downtown Seattle, for those who prefer an office setting

Whenever possible, Sprout wants to provide our team with the flexibility to work in the location that makes the most sense for them. Sprout maintains a remote workforce in many places in the United States. However, we are not set up in all states, so please look at the drop-down box in our application to see whether your state is listed. Few roles require an office setting. If your position requires a physical presence in a Sprout office, it will be evident in the job listing and your offer letter.


The base pay range for this role is $250,000 to $310,000 USD annually. Individual base pay is based on various factors, including relevant experience and skills, the responsibility of the role, and job duties/requirements. These ranges were determined by a market-based compensation approach; we used data from trusted third-party compensation sources to set equitable, consistent and competitive ranges. About the job

The Company


Outschool’s mission is to inspire kids to love learning. In our fast-changing world, the traditional educational system struggles to meet the diverse and evolving needs of young learners. Outschool reimagines this system, offering flexible and engaging learning experiences as a supplement and alternative to traditional education. By connecting learners with a global community of teachers and peers through our online platform, we make learning personal, dynamic, and deeply human.


We've made significant strides since launching our marketplace of live online classes in 2017. Finding initial success with secular homeschoolers, we then expanded to enrichment learning to meet the needs of a wider audience, growing our business 16x since 2019. Post-pandemic, we have evolved our platform to power academic learning, incorporated AI, and have begun to grow our international community. We're proud to have served over 1M passionate learners with more than $100M in annual bookings.


Driving disruptive, positive change in education is rewarding and hard. Outschool team members are encouraged to challenge themselves, take risks, and grow in their careers. We look for talented people whose sense of urgency, innate curiosity, and determination to drive impact will help Outschool achieve outsized results in pursuit of our mission. We invite you to be part of an ambitious team dedicated to ensuring every learner can navigate the future with curiosity, resilience, and a love of learning.


Outschool has been named Fast Company’s most innovative EdTech company in the world, and one of the top ten best startups for women from Elpha. Outschool has also been one of BuiltIn’s Best Remote Places to Work for the last two years and has appeared on Y Combinator’s Top Companies list for the last three years.

We're seeking an exceptional engineering leader to drive technical innovation and transformation, with a special focus on AI/ML-driven personalization and recommendations for our marketplace. The ideal candidate will either have experience transforming engineering cultures or building high-performance engineering organizations from the ground up. This role combines hands-on technical leadership with strategic vision to scale our platform and drive significant business impact. This role will report into the Head of Outschool/CEO.


At Outschool, we’ve decided to take an unconventional approach to titles that aligns with our values and is more focused on impact above status - this role would typically be called a VP or SVP of Engineering and we are looking for candidates who bring that level of experience to the role. You can read more about our titling philosophy here.


Key Responsibilities


  • Lead technical strategy and hands-on development of AI/ML capabilities, focusing on personalization and recommendations

About You


You're a technical leader who combines deep engineering expertise with strong cultural leadership. You have a track record of either transforming engineering organizations or building high-performing teams from scratch. You're hands-on, strategic, and passionate about using technology to drive business impact.


Required Experience & Skills


  • Deep expertise in AI/ML, particularly recommendation systems and personalization
  • Strong coding abilities and system design experience
  • 10+ years engineering leadership experience
  • Led engineering organizations of 30+ people
  • Track record of successful product launches in consumer marketplaces or consumer software is critical

  • Preference for SF/Bay area or a willingness to travel regularly for in-person time with our team

Our Values


Our organization is built on three core values that shape everything we do:


Learning By Doing


We value learning by doing, using startup methods, which inherently means embracing risk and change. We look to the future rather than holding onto the past. We are positive, bold and resilient to setbacks. We hone our craft by trying new approaches and learning together.


Scaling For Impact


We value scaling to grow our impact for many more learners. Achieving scale requires building a large, profitable, global business to enable our mission for the long-term. We use our scale to better understand, and sustainably serve, the broad and diverse needs of all learners.


Disrupting The Status Quo


We value disrupting the status quo in service of our mission. The status-quo education system is unacceptable to us, so we are willing to embrace challenge, discomfort and even controversy in service of fast progress. We make hard decisions, take ownership and bias towards action.


Our Leadership Principles


These core values manifest in how we work every day:


Learning By Doing


  • Embrace experimentation and calculated risks
  • Learn through rapid iteration and feedback
  • Stay resilient through setbacks
  • Focus on continuous improvement

Scaling For Impact


  • Build for growth while maintaining quality
  • Make data-driven decisions
  • Think strategically about long-term scalability
  • Balance speed with sustainability

Drive Change & Innovation


  • Push boundaries in technical solutions
  • Challenge status quo when needed
  • Maintain strong opinions, loosely held
  • Embrace and drive transformation

Hands-On Leadership


  • Actively participate in technical discussions
  • Deliver high-quality output
  • Remove obstacles for the team
  • Maintain attention to detail

Company First


  • Prioritize long-term company success
  • Make decisions aligned with strategic goals
  • Focus on collective impact
  • Build for the greater good

Outschool Cares


At Outschool, we believe that taking care of one another enables us to do our best work. To us that means:

$196,800 - $295,200 a year

This position will be based out of Tempe, Arizona or Charlotte, North Carolina and covers all business units and countries where Circle K operates.


The role will require a high degree of collaboration across all business functions including the Global Technology and Global Data & Analytics teams. It will involve evangelizing effective data management practices, determining how to best leverage relevant existing and emerging technologies, and promoting better understanding and utilization of data and analytics at Circle K. Working with key functional partners and stakeholders, internal technical subject-matter experts, suppliers, and industry experts having the right data, avoiding data bias by including data from varied sources, ensuring the fitness for use and quality of the data and providing the mechanisms to share/leverage common data solutions across CircleK.


In this role, the Head of Global Data Engineering and BI, manages and controls:


  • Logical and physical corporate data warehouse and data marts for specific business areas to minimize data redundancy
  • Specific analytics and business intelligence (BI) platforms and tools to share and leverage analytic insights across the company
  • The investigation and application of relevant emerging technology in the Data and Analytics domain, including GenAI

A large focus of this role is to lead the team responsible for building, managing and optimizing the enterprise data supply chain for key data and analytics consumers (e.g., business & data analysts, data scientists, etc.) to drive business value. The team will ensure data pipelines, models and algorithms are optimized for data integrity, performance, security, and governance.


Responsibilities


Job Description


  • Building and maintaining the data supply chain: The primary responsibility of this role will be to lead a team that architects, builds and manages the Company’s data supply chain. This will entail ingestion of both existing and future-state data sources to be determined based on business needs
  • Being a data and analytics evangelist: This role will promote the available data and analytics capabilities and expertise to functional heads and business unit leaders and educate them in how to best leverage these capabilities in achieving their business goals. In addition, this role will bring relevant leading-edge technology into the solution set for driving business value more quickly.
  • Collaborate across functions: The leader will require strong collaboration skills to work with varied stakeholders within the organization. Work in close relationship with cross-functional leaders to scope and prioritize initiatives.
  • Manage the technology for the data ecosystem: Build, integrate, and maintain enterprise data & analytics technologies for: data ingestion; brokering and integration; data warehouse / lake; data marts; and reporting, visualization, and other business intelligence tools.
  • Review and enhance development standards and best practices: Ensure repeatable and scalable solutions to deliver high quality data products and solutions to the enterprise (e.g., Dev Ops, CI/CD, data quality automations, peer code reviews, knowledge sharing, support model, etc.)

Qualifications


The Head of Global Data Engineering and BI must have considerable experience with data management and analytics processes and technology. In addition, we expect:


  • A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, data science, business analytics, statistics, applied mathematics, information systems, information science or a related quantitative field (or equivalent work experience) required.
  • Strong experience and knowledge in retail industry preferred
  • At least ten years of experience in data analytics leadership roles, managing data engineering and BI teams to deliver global enterprise data solutions using Data Lake, Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence capabilities.
  • Experience in managing large, globally distributed teams
  • At least 5 years of experience hiring and mentoring high caliber, data focused engineers with diverse technical strengths and background
  • Deep experience with data engineering, big data and analytical technologies using cloud-based data platforms
  • Expert in guiding the organization to make data-driven decisions by providing clear, concise, and accurate data insights
  • A track record of identifying relevant leading-edge technology and achieving benefits of early adoption.
  • Strong supplier management, negotiation, and commercial skills.
  • Strong financial skills to effectively manage the operational and project budgets (including forecasts and to provide resourcing cost estimates to support new demands
  • Experience in integrating complex, cross-functional processes, and data models.
  • Broad experience in multiple domain areas including data warehousing; business intelligence (BI); data architecture; data integration; data engineering, data classification; data strategy; data quality management; and enterprise architecture framework.
  • Required technical skills and experience:
  • Advanced Data Engineering: expert in data mesh reference architecture, data modeling, developing, and optimizing ETL (Extract, Transform & Load) processes and data pipeline development. Experience with Azure Data Factory, Apache Airflow, and various data ingestion methods (batch, streaming, API, enterprise hub) required.
  • Data Warehousing: strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, practices, and tools such as SnowFlake
  • Consumption Tools: good understanding of BI tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Qualtrics, etc.
  • Cloud Platforms: strong experience with Microsoft Azure, AWS and Google Cloud and their data services (Azure Synapse, Redshift, BigQuery)
  • Data Governance and Security: Familiarity with data privacy laws, regulatory compliance, ethics of data use, and data security best practices
  • AI /ML Platforms: strong experience with DataBricks
  • Advanced Analytics Tools: Experience with R, Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
  • Common Database Programming Languages: Experience with SQL, MongoDB, and Cassandra
  • Experience in working with large, heterogeneous datasets
  • Experience with Data science and machine learning models and algorithms
  • Experience with Automation tools such as Trifacta, Paxata, etc.
  • Experience with Agile and Scrum development, preferably with SaFe Agile

Knowledge/Skills


  • Strong, results-driven personality with a high level of enthusiasm, energy and confidence
  • Demonstrated leadership; proven track record of leading complex, new endeavors and delivering solutions.
  • A sense of urgency with a demonstrated commitment to high ethical standards, comfort with regulatory compliance, customer service and business integrity
  • Ability to work with ambiguity as the organization continues to evolve
  • Strong leadership skills to move the team through a major change, initiative to drive change forward and identify solutions to potential obstacles
  • Effective communication and relationship-building skills to work collaboratively with Operational Business Units, Global Functions and Global Tech stakeholders
  • Ability to share information across business functions and disciplines; manage stakeholders with diverse interests; make actionable recommendations
  • Excellent communication, organizational and presentation skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills: able to work across business lines at senior levels to influence and effect change to achieve common goals
  • Ability to effectively drive people, process, and technology change in a dynamic and complex operating environment
  • Demonstrated ability to work as part of a global team, including understanding how to navigate cultural differences in workstyles and communications
  • Strong people management skills to help develop team members in the competency-based org structure
  • Strong analytical skills to derive actionable insights from complex datasets
  • Ability to diagnose data-related issues and implement effective solutions
  • Develop solutions which focus on how to successfully extract insight from big data
  • Keen understanding of business objectives and ability to apply this understanding to recommend practical solutions
  • Strategic technology planning and execution experience, policy development and maintenance
  • Effectively communicate in English, in both written and oral forms

Join us in redefining what it means to work for a CRO. Working at Rho, you’ll be joining a team who take healthcare and clinical research personally, with shared experiences that drive a passion to heal, cure and solve some of humanity’s biggest challenges.


At Rho, we’re committed to you just as you’re committed to us. With a collaborative team of smart, talented, and positive people, you’ll be celebrated and respected for your expertise and given the freedom to think creatively, challenge the norm, and problem-solve.


We are currently hiring a Senior Director, Data Management, to join our team!


The Senior Director of Data Management will provide overall strategic and tactical leadership to Rho’s Data Management team. This role will support DM sales in both integrated services and stand-alone advisory bids, ensure timely deliverables of the highest quality, facilitate shared learning and knowledge retention, and provide solutions to resolve problems while improving efficiency within the team. This role also oversees staff performance management, talent development, and ensures all are trained and compliant with current SOPs. This role provides operational guidance and serves as a mentor to develop staff.


In addition to serving in a management role for Rho data management staff, the Director of Data Management will also oversee studies - attend client meetings, provide strategic project planning, and allocate study resourcing . The Director of Data Management is just as comfortable advising study leaders on standards-compliant approaches to EDC database design as overseeing study data collection in a pivotal trial, ensuring error-free operation and support for biostatistic s and safety case reporting.


The Director of Data Management will also be responsible for leading and engaging in departmental and cross functional initiatives.


Our Data Management Team will tell you, joining Rho has been one of their best career moves in terms of contentment, financial rewards and career growth, which is why we have such stability in the group!


Responsibilities


Management of the Data Management Department


  • Participate in cross functional-area leadership teams representing Data Management.
  • Serve as overall manager of Data Management, setting priorities and goals, and reporting to management on pr ogress toward goals and overall department performance . This includes personnel development, projections, gaps and potential needs, highlighting key areas of accomplishments, metrics and risks
  • Collaborate with project teams and functional area SMEs across the business, to ensure customer satisfaction, high quality deliverables, and profitability of studies
  • Participate in special assignments, process assessments and development of project aids such as standards, templates, guidances , etc.

  • Stay current on data management and industry trends and how these may impact development and data management approaches
  • Participate in quality efforts for continuous improvement by assuring quality metrics are in line with company, client and data management objectives ; participate in defining strategies for new processes and technology; Identify efficiencies and trends across studies; provide advice and solutions to solve problems and improve efficiency across functions, projects and customers.

  • Pa rtner wit h BD to pa rticipate in propos al devel opment, cl ient pres entations and/ or bid defen se meetings as neede d

Management responsibilities for Clinical Data Associates and Clinical Data Managers


  • Ensure that data management deliverables are on time, on budget, and error free
  • Meet regularly with employees to provide mentorship and discuss development and performance
  • Maintain retrospective and prospective vigilance of utilization , realization, availability to take on additional work and paid time off
  • Provide mentorship in all aspects of data management

  • Provide data management training by implementing effective orientation, mentoring, and career development opportunities
  • Ensure staff fulfill their responsibilities in accordance with policies, procedures, SOPs, ICH-GCPs, and country specific regulatory requirements; ensure staff compliance with assigned trainings

  • A t least five years ’ experience managing staff ;
  • At least five years’ experience representing DM in cross-functional study teams ;
  • Demonstrated experience representing DM with external partners (e.g., sponsor, CRO, regulator);
  • Serving as lead DM on stud ies conducted in the US and at least two other countries ;
  • Representing DM in the sales process.

  • Demonstrated e xperience with Medidata Rave; experience with additional EDC platforms is a plus;
  • Understanding of computer data and data structures;
  • Demonstrated e xperience with EDC, RTSM, ePRO from database development to close-out;
  • Fluency with international DM standards and able to lead a discussion on their implementation
  • Strong understanding of project staffing and typical data management team structures
  • Solid understanding of staff and study management
  • C lear understanding of the drug development process
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers, managers and clients
  • Demonstrates effective , systematic decision-making skills
  • Experience developing and mentoring staff
  • Proven ability to balance competing priorities; ability to see patterns in issues, discount non-issues and prioritize to make progress
  • Proactive and effective communicator
  • Ability to identify issues within a project and lead the team to resolution

About the job

Our purpose is to positively impact people’s lives every day in every home around the world! We work very hard to provide our consumers with high-quality, exciting 5-star products that make life easier. We thrive on passion and innovation and are looking for great people, with great ideas, who want to build the next big thing and develop while they do.


Job Description:


We are seeking a dynamic Director, Data Science & Analytics (Amazon) to join our team. The primary responsibility is to serve as the "Chief Amazon Marketplace Explorer," continuously testing to uncover breakthroughs in all cross-functional capabilities utilizing technology and data. The ideal Director, Data Science & Analytics (Amazon) has an insatiable desire to create breakthrough strategies with the experience to own our data tech stack and global reporting & analytic best practice. As such, this position will manage a team that builds and maintains our executive global data and reporting. The successful Director, Data Science & Analytics will possess a deep understanding of the Amazon ecosystem, exceptional analytical skills, and a passion for identifying new opportunities that drive business growth. This role will sit on the Amazon Leadership team and must be able to support varying data sets across finance, operations, sales and marketing among others.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Serve as the Chief Amazon Explorer, creating a learning agenda to identify, test, iterate and scale innovative strategies and opportunities on Amazon.
  • Leverage technology and data analytics to uncover hidden insights and drive action across sales, marketing, logistics, and customer service.
  • Assess current technology partners and solutions to maximize utilization & pressure for incremental value (AMC, Digital Shelf Tools, Revenue Recovery, Content Optimization, Catalog Management etc.)
  • Collaborate with internal teams to implement and optimize Amazon-specific strategies based on findings.
  • Stay updated with trends, tools, and technologies within the Amazon marketplace to ensure competitiveness.
  • Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using tools like Tableau and Power BI to track performance metrics and present findings to senior leadership.
  • Identify opportunities to increase process automation and integrate AI/ML into practice.
  • Conduct market research and competitive analysis to inform strategic decisions and identify new growth opportunities.
  • Utilize advanced data analytics, including predictive modeling, statistical analysis, data mining, and machine learning, to drive decision-making and improve Amazon marketplace strategies.
  • Manage a team responsible for building and maintaining the company's Amazon data and reporting strategy while tackling internal projects
  • Oversee the creation and maintenance of a Global Amazon Reporting Center of Excellence.
  • Participate in the Amazon Leadership team, contributing to strategic decision-making and overseeing global responsibilities.

Your Role within the Team:


  • Foster a data-driven culture, leveraging data analytics for informed decision-making.
  • Provide strategic insights from data analytics, identifying trends and opportunities to support business decisions.
  • Develop forward-looking data strategies to create new competitive advantages.
  • Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with relevant regulations.
  • Lead and mentor a team of data professionals.

Duties and Responsibilities:


  • Develop and execute the data analytics strategy to support company objectives.
  • Drive advanced analytics initiatives, including predictive modeling, statistical analysis, data mining, and machine learning.
  • Establish KPIs to measure business effectiveness and drive improvement.
  • Collaborate with central teams on data collection, integration, validation, and storage.
  • Identify and interpret trends in complex data sets.
  • Design and maintain dashboards (Tableau / Power BI) to support information requirements.
  • Implement data analytic tools to enhance data analytics capabilities.
  • Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and robust data security measures.
  • Stay informed about advancements in data analytics, technologies, and industry best practices.

Desired Skills and Experience:


  • Proven experience (5+ years) in a leadership role overseeing data analytics functions, preferably in the CPG industry or a related field.
  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, computer science, statistics, or a related field.
  • Expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, data mining, and machine learning techniques.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL).
  • Experience with big data platforms, cloud-based data analytics solutions, and data warehousing.
  • Strong business acumen and ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  • Knowledge of regulatory requirements and best practices related to data privacy and security.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Proven experience with Amazon Vendor & Seller Central, Digital Shelf Tools, Full Funnel Media, and Audience Marketing Cloud data sets.
  • Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills.
  • Driven, eager to learn, and a collaborative team player.
  • Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
  • Experience with global responsibilities and participating in leadership teams.

Join us as the Director, Data Science & Analytics (Amazon) and lead the charge in discovering new horizons within the Amazon marketplace. Apply today to be part of our dynamic team and drive transformative growth through technology and data!
